markdown.markdown: Researcher / lecturer at the Chemnitz University of Technology. {{< fa solid graduation-cap size=lg >}}   **Habilitation in Computer Science** 2017 $\rightarrow$ Chemnitz University of Technology, Germany. {{< fa solid graduation-cap size=lg >}}   **Ph.D. in Computer Science** 2006 $\rightarrow$ Université Henri Poincaré Nancy-I, France. {{< fa solid graduation-cap size=lg >}}   **Engineering degree in Signal Processing and Microelectronics** 2002 $\rightarrow$ École Supérieure d'Électricité (Supélec), Rennes, France. {{< fa solid graduation-cap size=lg >}}   **Master of Science in Microelectronics** 2002 $\rightarrow$ Université Rennes-I, France. ## Experience {{< fa solid person-chalkboard size=lg >}}   **Chemnitz University of Technology** - Germany 2011 - now $\rightarrow$ Researcher / lecturer in the faculty of Computer science, AI lab of [Fred Hamker](https://www.tu-chemnitz.de/informatik/KI). * Research: * Computational neuroscience: basal ganglia, dopamine, hippocampus. * Neuroinformatics: neurosimulator [ANNarchy](https://github.com/ANNarchy/ANNarchy) * Machine learning, reinforcement learning. * Teaching: * Neurocomputing / Machine Learning * Deep Reinforcement Learning * Computer Vision * Introduction to AI. * Erasmus+ departmental coordinator. --- {{< fa solid microscope size=lg >}}   **WWU University of Münster** - Germany 2006 - 2011 $\rightarrow$ Postdoc in the Institute of Psychology, lab of Markus [Lappe](https://www.uni-muenster.de/PsyIFP/AELappe), supervisor Fred Hamker. * Research: * Computational neuroscience: basal ganglia. --- {{< fa solid school size=lg >}}   **Inria Lorraine** - France 2002 - 2006 $\rightarrow$ PhD student in the Cortex team (LORIA Nancy), supervisors Frédéric Alexandre and Nicolas Rougier (now in [Mnemosyne](https://team.inria.fr/mnemosyne/)). * Research: * Computational neuroscience: basal ganglia, visual attention. * Robotics. * Teaching (at the University of Nancy-I): * Computer architecture, Java, AI. ## Skills {{< fa solid code size=lg >}}   Programming languages: Python, C++, C, Julia {{< fa brands phoenix-framework size=lg >}}   Machine learning frameworks: tensorflow, pytorch, scikit-learn {{< fa solid network-wired size=lg >}}   Parallel computing: OpenMP, MPI, CUDA ## Third-party projects ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## EU CAVAA 2022 - 2026 $\rightarrow$ Counterfactual Assessment and Valuation for Awareness Architecture. *Partners:* Radboud University, TU Chemnitz, CERTH, Sorbonne Université, Eodyne Systems, Univeryity of Sheffield, Robotnik Automation, University of Oxford, Uppsala University, tp21 GmbH. *Role:* Research. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## BMBF Smart AirSense (01IS22026A) 2022 - 2024 $\rightarrow$ Erforschung von KI Methoden zur Entwicklung eines interaktiven Gesundheitsassistenten auf Basis von Human in the Loop Machine Learning. *Partners:* Corant GmbH, TU Chemnitz. *Role:* Design, co-supervision of Aida Farahani and Payam Atoofi. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## BMBF WAIKIKI (16KIS1199) 2020 - 2023 $\rightarrow$ Wissensbasierte Anomalieerkennung mittels Künstlicher Intelligenz in Kritischen Infrastrukturen. *Partners:* TU Cottbus, TU Chemnitz, LEAG, RWE AG, STEAG GmbH, ASCORI GmbH, migosens GmbH, ZEDAS GmbH. *Role:* Design, co-supervision of René Larisch. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## BMBF ML@Karoprod (01IS18055C) 2018 - 2021 $\rightarrow$ Maschinelles Lernen zur Prognose von Prozessparametern und Bauteilqualität in der automobilen Karosserieproduktion. *Partners:* Fraunhofer IWU Dresden, Scale GmbH, TU Chemnitz. *Role:* Design, research, co-supervision of Aida Farahani and Payam Atoofi. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## DFG grant (HA2630/9-1) 2016 - 2019 $\rightarrow$ Auto-tuning for neural simulations on different parallel hardware. *Partners:* TU Chemnitz (Hamker). *Role:* Design, co-supervision of Helge Dinkelbach. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## ESF project Helplessness 2016 - 2019 $\rightarrow$ Sozial agierende, kognitive Systeme zur Feststellung von Hilfsbedürftigkeit. *Partners:* TU Chemnitz. *Role:* Principal Investigator ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## BMBF Macelot (16SV7260) 2015 - 2018 $\rightarrow$ StayCentered - Methodenbasis eines Assistenzsystems für Centerlotsen - MACeLot. *Partners:* TU Chemnitz. *Role:* Research. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## DFG graduate school Crossworlds (GRK 1780) 2012 - 2016 $\rightarrow$ CrossWorlds: Kopplung virtueller und realer sozialer Welten *Partners:* TU Chemnitz. *Role:* Principal investigator. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## DFG grant (HA2630/4-2) 2011 - 2014 $\rightarrow$ The cognitive control of visual perception and action selection. *Partners:* TU Chemnitz (Hamker). *Role:* Research. ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## DFG grant (HA2630/4-1) 2006 - 2009 $\rightarrow$ A systems approach to modeling the cognitive guidance of attention and object/category recognition. *Partners:* TU Chemnitz (Hamker). *Role:* Research (employed). ::: ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"} ## EU Mirrorbot 2002 - 2005 $\rightarrow$ Biomimetic Multimodal Learning in a Mirror Neuron-based Robot. *Partners:* Sunderland, Inria, Parma, Cambridge, Ulm. *Role:* Research (employed). :::
